Description: Body sherd of pottery cup, possibly a one-handler or kantharos-style cup, with a slight ridge at the transition to the rim; very micaceous, light beige-orange clay, with matt red slip or glaze on outside; inside smoothed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AP2
Curator's comments: Marked 'AP2' in pencil. From same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.749, 751 and perhaps 750 (joining 749) as well as Boston MFA 86.932 (although the latter is marked in pencil '6').
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.219)
